intro: Carex phyllocaula, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, rushes, and similar plants. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a distinctive blue-green coloration. The inflorescence consists of a cylindrical spike of small, three-ranked flowers, which are wind-pollinated.
